about_the_game:
Love your tea, love your life.


Gameplay:
Become more and more proficient in the art of tea by making a daily brew each day.
Advancing the story unlocks a variety of tea leaves to choose from, with a particular focus on black tea.
Schedule events in your calendar that can boost luck and wellbeing and live a happy, peaceful life.

In the kitchen:
Practise making tea in the kitchen and play with different heat levels, tea leaves, and brewing times.
Then run taste tests until you discover the perfect brew.

Story:
Meet Yoru, who has been told he only has a few months left to live, and Chihiro, a high school student who keeps insisting on treating him to some delicious tea, for reasons unknown.
The two slowly pass his remaining time together, not at a café but at home, sharing some peace and quiet - and a few laughs - at a tea time just for two.

Features:
Many café games have a lot of tasks, such as running the business and serving countless tables. In this game, you only serve one person.
Plus, you should be able to recreate all the teas in the game at home with your own setup.

- Featuring Japanese and Chinese teas
- No need to be a master of tea party etiquette
- Easy controls: just click, drag, and drop!
- No prior knowledge of tea-making required
- Appropriate for all ages (in theory)

NOTE: If you do care about tea-making etiquette, please forgive the blasphemous idea of throwing tea leaves straight in the kettle.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: windows10/11
  • Processor: Any 64-bit Intel
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Any GPU that supports at least OpenGL 2.0, OpenGL ES 2.0, or DirectX 9.0
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
